oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Brief Account of the Execution of the Six Militia Men
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: John Binns
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Anti-Jackson campaign broadside issued during the 1828 Presidential race between Andrew Jackson and John Quincy Adams. Illustrated with six wooden coffins, signifying the six Tennessee militia men who were executed for mutiny during the New Orleans campaign.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Ephemera; Militias; Presidential elections;
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Office of the Democratic Press, Philadelphia
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please refer to Image Number and provide a brief description of the photograph.
